annonstext:
Siemens Gamesa has a vision for renewable energy: we believe in the power of nature and technology. Help us to be ready to face the energy challenges of tomorrow and make a green footprint – join the team in creating a better future for us on our planet.

We focus on hiring the best people, wherever they may be in the world. We pride ourselves on the flexibility we offer to our employees and are committed to building a workforce that can grow with the company. Siemens Gamesa is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

In our culture of trust, we focus on empowerment, diversity, and continuous learning. Valuing our people is what makes us one global team, with our colleagues’ safety at the heart of our organization.

How to contribute to our vision

We are looking for a motivated student worker to support our Operations Managers.

In this role you will gain more technical knowledge and get a great understanding of how our global business works from within, while acting according to the long- and short-term goals, strategies and directives received from the management. A part of your responsibilities will be collecting, documenting, and recording the knowledge that you gain, in order to improve our processes. You will drive internal technical projects and provide administrative support to our Service Operations Team.

A big part of your tasks will be to process our incoming requests regarding our products. You will support our customers and suppliers regarding agreements and contracts while maintaining good customer relations and a high level of customer satisfaction. You will be in close contact with a broad variety of our clients, suppliers, and internal managers, while working in accordance with established processes, routines, and tools.

You will support both internal and external inquiries and are responsible for sending them to the right channel, if a more technical answer is needed. You need to have strong communication skills and ability to work with different stakeholders, as you might be assigned to give support to other parts of the organization.

Your tasks will be performed from home or our Malmö office.

What you need to make a difference

Passion for renewable energy and a sense for the importance to lead the change. The ideal candidate is currently completing their 3-4 year of studies in Industrial Engineering and Management, with focus on renewable/sustainability. Other similar degrees are also considered.

As a person you should be motivated by opportunities to learn and have a strong desire to improve and further develop your skills. You speak and write both English and Swedish fluently, as you will be in contact with many stakeholders on a regular basis. You are great at establishing connections to other people and are able to work concentrated while ensuring the smooth delivery of your tasks and responsibilities.

In return of your commitment we offer you…

Become a part of our mission for sustainability: Clean energy for generations to come. We are a global team of diverse colleagues who share a passion for renewable energy and have a culture of trust and empowerment to make our own ideas a reality. We focus on personal and professional development to grow internally within our organization. Siemens Gamesa offers a wide variety of benefits such as flexible working hours as well as home-office possibility for many colleagues, employer-funded pension, attractive remuneration package (fixed/variable) and local benefits such as subsided lunch, employee discounts and much more

Empowering our people 

https://www.siemensgamesa.com/sustainability/employees

How do you imagine the future? 

https://youtu.be/12Sm678tjuY

Our global team is on the front line of tackling the climate crisis, reducing carbon emissions – the greatest challenge we face.

Other information

For further information regarding the recruitment process, please contact the primary recruiter, FIRSTNAME LASTNAME, via email  EMAIL . Please mention the Job ID in the email.

Please apply in English via the apply button.

We kindly draw your attention to the fact that this email may NOT be used for sending applications or CVs for evaluation
